TopicTitle: Multiply mods but only some parts are showing

Articles.Content:
I am currently playing with a number of mods however only about half of the parts of the mods are showing in the parts list.

The mods are up to date and the part files are present in the game data folder.

An example of this is with B9. I have things like B9 wing segments, but no fuel tanks or cargo bays.

Or with the mk. IV mod. I have the mk. IV cockpit and cargo bays, but no mk. IV fuel tanks or cargo ramps.

The game is stable, it crashes very rarely but it does happen from time to time. I just want to get access to all the parts I have loaded so I can build heavy cargo planes. Any help that you guys could provide would be greatly appreciated. 

List of mods:

B9

chatterer

distant object

kerbal engineer

mrk IV

deadly reentry

edit: and I'm just realizing the error I made with the title. derp

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-09T17:30:48Z" title="03/09/2015 05:30  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 9, 2015</time> by mckay221**

Not enough info!!

What OS and what version of ksp are you running? If it is the 64bit ksp then just dump that and get the 32 bit version.

Can you post your output\_log? If you don't know where to get it [look here](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92229-How-To-Get-Support-%28READ-FIRST%29)

Did you install everything properly? B9 requires the Firespitter plugin to switch parts up, should be included in the download.

Do you know about the firespitter part switching? Pretty much all of B9s parts will be found under structural, place a part then right click it and it will let you switch between different fuel tank options and such from that one single part.

Ok sorry about that, still new to the forum. I'm on windows 8 (not 8.1, I mean 8) Its the current version of KSP, and yes it is the x64 version. I am fairly certain that firespitter is installed correctly but to be honest I'm not sure. Give me some time to find the output log.
Don't use 64x bit!! It is EXTREMELY unstable! Get 32x bit, the devs won't even have a 64x bit version in 1.0!
If I go to 32x will I be able to bring my saves over?

> 
> If I go to 32x will I be able to bring my saves over?

honestly I don't know, but x64 is extremely unstable, especially with mods, a lot of mods just don't work properly and the base game itself has all kinds of weird bugs.

Either way I would get the x86 version, and if you can bring your saves over then sweet, if not well at least the game will be playable lol.

When you make the switch don't forget to get [Active Texture Managemen](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/59005-0-90-Release-4-3-Dec-16-2014-Active-Texture-Management-Save-RAM!)t as well, it will help reduce out of memory crashes and allow you to run more part mods if you want to, and in case you are one of those people that install a mod before reading all of the fine print, the first load with ATM will take a long time as it goes through and compresses all of the textures.

I'm going to guess at: installation error. They're not showing up because they share textures and the parts that are missing are being told their texture should be at X when it actually is at XX etc. There should be no KSP\Gamedata\Gamedata\B9\_Aerospace or whatever.. could you post a screenshot of your Gamedata folder please?
